videoflix.asgi module

ASGI config for videoflix project.

It exposes the ASGI callable as a module-level variable named application.

For more information on this file, see https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/5.1/howto/deployment/asgi/

videoflix.simpleworker module

class videoflix.simpleworker.BaseDeathPenalty(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: object

class videoflix.simpleworker.SimpleWorker(queues, name: str | None = None, default_result_ttl=500, connection: Redis | None = None, exc_handler=None, exception_handlers=None, default_worker_ttl=420, maintenance_interval: int = 600, job_class: Type[Job] | None = None, queue_class: Type[Queue] | None = None, log_job_description: bool = True, job_monitoring_interval=30, disable_default_exception_handler: bool = False, prepare_for_work: bool = True, serializer=None, work_horse_killed_handler: Callable[[Job, int, int, struct_rusage], None] | None = None)

Bases: Worker

death_penalty_class

alias of BaseDeathPenalty

execute_job(*args, **kwargs)

Execute job in same thread/process, do not fork()

main_work_horse(*args, **kwargs)

This is the entry point of the newly spawned work horse. After fork()’ing, always assure we are generating random sequences that are different from the worker.

os._exit() is the way to exit from childs after a fork(), in contrast to the regular sys.exit()
